title: My family and home town
creator_contributor_role: Australia. Dept. of Education, Employment and Workplace Relations, partner
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Aboriginal Australians - Social conditions
Aboriginal Australia/Aboriginal Australians - Social life and customs
abstract: A tribute to the close knit family and community of a young boy.
description: Gerald Phineasa loves his family and small community of Bamaga in far North Queensland. His large family have plenty of animals and are starting to race horses and he looks forward to returning from his school break in Brisbane to days of riding and fishing. His town is small but somehow has everything Gerald would want. A loving tribute and a snapshot of a small rural community.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2001913; One past eight futures : Foundation for Young Australians : Digital Storytelling project; Active; 2009
